name: Symptomatic Hepatic Cyst with Hemorrhage
chief_complaint: Sudden severe right upper quadrant pain and nausea
prognosis: Good with treatment; 85% success rate with sclerotherapy. Recurrence possible in 10-15% of cases.
description: A complicated hepatic cyst with intracystic hemorrhage causing acute symptoms. The cyst measures approximately 8cm with heterogeneous density on imaging suggesting recent bleeding. Common in middle-aged women but can occur in any demographic.
